intro: Pedicularis ikomae, commonly known as the Ikomae lousewort, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its reddish-purple flowers and hairy stems, often growing in shaded, moist environments. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
